rules.ruleString: Must have passed an (I/W) unit in {BMA1901}
Incompatible with achievement in (I/W) {BMA1012, BMA1912, BMS2011, BMS2031, NUR1114, PHY2011, PHY2021, PHY2032, PHY2042}
Unit was previously coded {BMS1902, HSC1302, NUR1302}
Incompatible with achievement in (I/W) {BMA1012, BMA1912, BMS2011, BMS2031, PHY2011, PHY2021, PHY2032, PHY2042}
Unit was previously coded {BMS1902, HSC1302, NUR1302}
Must have passed an (I/W) unit in {BMA1901}
Must be enrolled in course version {3445, 3869, M2002%, M3001}
Must be enrolled in course version {D30%, M2002%, M3001}

description: This unit is the second in a sequence of two health science units that provides foundation knowledge of human anatomy and physiology relevant for allied health professions and further develops skills in the critical evaluation of evidence.The major themes of study in this unit are: body support and movement, cardiovascular anatomy and physiology, the respiratory system, the urinary system and the control of body fluids; the digestive system and the processing of nutrients in the body; the lymphoid/immune system; microbes and infection; and an introduction to pharmacological principles.
faculty: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences
